availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Guess (Crittenden County, Kentucky, soldier and alleged guerilla.)

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, soldier and alleged guerilla. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a sergeant and lieutenant from January 6, 1862, to January 17, 1864. Accused of alleged guerilla activity in Crittendon County in 1865. Indicted for burglary, larceny, murder, and robbery, in Crittenden County in 1865. Fugitive from justice in November 1865.

ab.bibl:
